document_data.name: Grick
document_data.Description:
The main body of an adult grick was about {{SI|6|ft}} long. Including the length of the tentacles, this made a grick about {{SI|8|ft}} long. and a snapping beak surrounded by large barbed tentacles. The tentacles would cover the beak unless the grick was attacking or eating.

Grick skin was rubbery and uniformly dark with with pale underbellies.{{Cite_dungeon/161/Touch_of_Madness}} .Their skin would camouflage well in rocky terrain and shadows.
document_data.Behavior:
Gricks were almost always hungry and would seek to hunt anything that moves (except other gricks)

Gricks were adept at climbing and could slither up walls with little difficulty.
document_data.Combat:
Gricks preferred to hunt in packs but could also be found hunting alone. Gricks hunted by waiting in busy areas and ambushing their prey. Gricks used their natural camoflage to remain hidden in rocky terrain.

If hunting in a pack, gricks would manoeuvre to outflank their pray wherever possible.. Due to their relatively small beaks, gricks could only take small bites of food. As a result gricks preferred to drag prey back to their nest once it was unconscious or dead.
document_data.Ecology:
[[File:Grick's meal.png|thumb|right|300px|''A grick and its next meal.'']]
Gricks laid oblong blue/green eggs about the size of a human fist.<ref> Young gricks were known as grick wormlings.{{Cite dungeon/210/The Vulture's Feast}} Grick wormlings were edible and were known to be served in the [[Dalelands]] stuffed with rice pilaf and diced celery. Cured and spiced grick tentacles were also eaten.<ref>

Gricks could be made to serve [[Aberration|abberrant]] creatures like [[grell]]s.<ref>

Due to the grick's constant need to eat, some explorers consider the best way to kill a grick is to seal it inside its nest and wait for it to starve to death.
document_data.Notable Gricks: * A particularly large and intelligent grick, distinguished by a bright green beak, made its home in the [[Ankhapur/Sewers|sewers of Ankhapur]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite web/Perilous Gateways/Portals of the Moonstars: The Ankhapur Portal}}
document_data.History:
In [[-8170 DR]] the settlement of [[Alatorin]] was defended by gricks.<ref>

At some point after [[1372 DR]] the [[sewers of Waterdeep]] were home to a small population of gricks.<ref>

One of the [[circle of fangs]] rings was found on a chain around the neck of a drowned grick.{{Cite dungeon/181/Eye on the Realms: The Circle of Fangs}}

At some point prior to [[1479 DR]], the ruins of [[Harpshield Castle]] were infested with numerous gricks.<ref name ="SotSC">

In [[1491 DR]],{{Phandelver-time}} a [[goblin]] named [[Lhupo]] kept a pet grick in [[Cragmaw Castle]].<ref>
